transcript.text: It’s important to be able to tell the difference between gifts and entertainment.

contentText.text: Click on the following links to learn the differences between gifts and entertainment and how to report them appropriately:

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

popText.text:
What’s considered a gift?
  • With gifts, the giver does not enjoy any benefit (unlike entertainment, where the giver shares in the experience).
  • A gift does not provide an opportunity to discuss business.

• Gifts that are valued at or above USD$200 per gift or USD$400 cumulative per calendar year require formal reporting and review in accordance with the approval process of your business.
  • You must submit the “Gift” Form in order to get approval to keep gifts you receive that are valued at or above USD$200 per gift or at or above USD$400 per calendar year.
Forms can be found at http://complianceforms.jci.com

popText.text:
What’s considered entertainment?
  • With entertainment, the giver shares in the benefit by attending the dinner, going to the event, etc.
  • An entertainment event also provides an opportunity to discuss business, whereas a gift typically does not.
  • When providing entertainment, it must be reasonable and business related.
  • If entertainment is provided and no representative for the person paying for the event attends, this is actually classified as a gift and therefore subject to the gift reporting guidelines.

• Expenses for business entertainment provided by Johnson Controls (to external third parties or other Johnson Control colleagues) should be accurately reported in travel and expense reports.
  • Business entertainment provided by external third parties to employees of Johnson Controls employees does not require formal reporting.
  • Special rules apply to entertainment involving government officials. Please check the Delegation of Authority (DoA) matrix for your business and ensure you comply with the monetary thresholds and approval process required if you are entertaining government clients.
Forms can be found at http://complianceforms.jci.com
